intro: Crotalaria chamaepeuce, commonly known as the small-leaved cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used as a source of protein in some parts of the world. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils, making it a valuable crop in agricultural systems.
